Text: Heh, not too shabby.
Not too shabby?!
You must lead quite the luxurious lifestyle.
Your words sting like thorns.

I didn't mean it like that at all. I'm sure that's
just how it is with musicians who live off the
patronage of their patrons.

We are both artists, but for someone like me, who
makes her living with a pen, it's like we exist in
two different worlds.

How exactly did you not "mean it like that"?
You're such an air—
What's that?

Nothing! Anyway, let's go over what we've learned in
the Academic District for the day.
Understood. But first—
But first...
Room service!
Jugang Ruins

The site of ancient Church ruins located in Grazheim's
Academic district.

Although no official records remain, one theory is
that it was used as a training ground and arena for
the monks of the Church.

This theory is based on the extensive grounds
within the ruins that appear to have been used
for exercise.

The outer grounds surrounding the ruins are open
to tourists, but access to the interior is forbidden to
anyone other than those involved with the Church,
both in the name of preservation and due to threat
of monsters.

...As for its location, it is in a prominent position
in the Academic District. Along with the Cathedral
of Orum, it is also a popular tourist attraction.
Even though you can't actually go inside the ruins?

Even if it were just piles of stones, humans are the
sort of creatures who would try to find meaning in
them.

And you think there are clues about the Templar in
the ruins?

It is not yet confirmed, but an MNA journalist has
hinted at it.

In fact, on preliminary inspection, it's quite
convenient as a hiding place for the Templar.
Convenient? How so?

First, the general public is not allowed to enter.
Also, the management is not that thorough.

Those things alone make it quite the perfect place
for a hideout.

"The goddess will punish anyone who tries to reveal
her secrets!" I wonder if they are using this plot as
a cover?

...I meant that as a joke, but you're pretty serious,
 aren't you?

It is due to the strength of the Church's influence
that such reasons are accepted and validated by
the public.

When you put it that way, it kind of sounds like the
Templar is a secret organization within the Church,
rather than an organization associated with it.
Heh...
...What? Are you saying I'm wrong?

Well... I thought it was a bold assumption without
any basis.
Sorry. Unlike you, I'm an intuituve person.

But if you think about it in that light, the ruins
become an even more convenient place for them.

It would be a place where they could hide in plain
sight and train their fighters.

You mean to tell me that the Templars are training
like monks for battle? Inside the ruins smack in the
middle of the city?!

If no one ever thought them to be so brazen as to
do it right under everyone's noses, it could be the
perfect place for them. You know?

Of course, no one would think that. Who would think
that a secret organization could be hiding in broad
daylight, right in the center of the Academic District!
Similar to how Mitsugoshi is for Shadow Garden.

That being said, the Jugang Ruins should be explored
as a top priority when it comes to the Church.

Yeah. I'm sure there are some secrets hidden in the
cathedral, but let's start with the area nearby.

If we find nothing we can focus our investigation on
the cathedral, and if we do find something, then our
investigation could be a great success.
That's all from me. Any progress on your end?

Well, more like laying some groundwork. I've spread
the word to my patrons that you and I are taking a
tour of the ruins.

How are we going to get anything done after you've
gone and done a thing like that!

Hey, there's no reason to get mad. It'll make it seem
less strange that we're spending all day there.

Even if someone catches us as we're leaving the
ruins, we can always put on an innocent face and
be like, "I just wanted to enjoy the night breeze."
Oh... You mean...!

We have our public personas. We should make full use
of them when we can.

What? You didn't intend to complete the project from
beginning to end in a covert manner, did you?
Ahaha... Well... I guess I sort of did, didn't I?

That's because you don't get out much... If it were
a completely covert investigation, Zeta would have
done it in the first place.

It's not what you said yesterday, but think about the
meaning of what we do, or what we can do because
of who we are.
Understood!
Hehe. If you got it, then good.

...What we can do because of who we are—that is
indeed important, isn't it?

Epsilon, let's make sure this mission is a success
and bring back results.
Yeah.
Then, to our success!
Cheers!
Cheers!
